required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: the Accuracy and Safety of Coronary Artery Contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging With Polysaccharide Superparamagnetic Iron Oxide Nanoparticle
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Domestic Polysaccharide Superparamagnetic Iron Oxide Nanoparticle Injection for Coronary Artery Contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Contrast-enhanced Angiography

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

collaborator.agency: School of Bioscience & Medical Engineering, Southeast University
School of Biomedical Engineering & Informatics, Nanjing Medical University
Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, prospective, controlled and diagnostic clinical trial which will enroll 30 patients scheduled for coronary angiography in China.Patients will receive contrast-enhanced cardiac magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before percutaneous coronary angiography.In order to evaluate the safety of polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle, patients will detect iron levels in peripheral and tissue before and after the examination.The main indicators of the study are the degree of coronary artery stenosis and the stability of coronary atherosclerotic plaque assessed by contrast-enhanced cardiac magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle.

primary_outcome.measure: The degree of coronary artery stenosis
primary_outcome.description: Degree of coronary artery stenosis assessed by contrast-enhanced cardiac magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle.

primary_outcome.measure: The degree of coronary artery stenosis
primary_outcome.description: Degree of coronary artery stenosis assessed by quantitative coronary angiography.

primary_outcome.measure: Plaque stability of coronary atherosclerotic plaques
primary_outcome.description: Plaque stability of coronary atherosclerotic plaques assessed by contrast-enhanced cardiac magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle.

primary_outcome.measure: Plaque stability of coronary atherosclerotic plaques
primary_outcome.description: Plaque stability of coronary atherosclerotic plaques assessed by Optical coherence tomography.
Blood routine examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate general condition of patients.
Blood biochemistry examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate liver function.
Urine routine examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
24-hour urine biochemistry examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Retinol binding protein examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Determination of serum iron before and after ECMR to evaluate the changes of iron content in peripheral blood.
Determination of serum ferritin before and after ECMR to evaluate the changes of iron content in peripheral blood.
Determination of serum transferrin before and after ECMR to evaluate the changes of iron content in peripheral blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of iron content in tissues between different time points
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of tissue iron content by T1W MRI before and after ECMR.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive contrast-enhanced cardiac magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before percutaneous coronary angiography.

intervention.intervention_name: domestic polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle
intervention.description: Patients will receive contrast-enhanced cardiac magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before percutaneous coronary angiography.Patients received intravenous polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before magnetic resonance imaging.

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr., MD, Ph.D, Director of CCU Ward

clinical_study.keyword: Ultrasmall Superparamagnetic Particles of Iron Oxide
